choices.C: Ensure the user is correctly set up in the Woodford solution.
choices.B: Ensure the user is has the Field Service-Resource security role.
choices.D: Ensure the user is assigned the appropriate Microsoft Power Apps license.
choices.A: Ensure the minimum supported version of the Field Service solution is installed.

questions.question_text:
Your organization is planning to implement Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app based on the Microsoft Power Platform.

You need to install this app on a mobile device and test it.

What are the two prerequisites for installing the mobile app? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: i thought it could be d) It's included in your Field Service license at no extra charge. this says me it needs a field service license. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/field-service/mobile/overview but having a very old un-supported field service solution installed... not sure.. difficult to have this in cloud... on prem possible and then it may work. but is it a 'power apps' license? it sould be a field service license...!

questions.question_text:
During User Acceptance Testing, mobile technicians receive the message "Contact your administrator for access to your organizationâ€™s mobile apps." when logging into the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.

You need to determine which areas to update within the mobile project so that technicians can see the appropriate information.

What is a possible way to troubleshoot the issue?

discussion.content:
i can rule out 
A. Update the mobile offline profile to include the correct Field Service security roles.
D. Ensure you have the correct security role (Field Service - Offline Resource), and that the security role is assigned to the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.
because a) i did not see the option to add roles to an offline profile 
d) does not exist.
remains b or c possible 
c) you actually can add users to the mobile offline profile (but if you have an organisation of 5 users this might be okay but if you have an organisation of 5000+ users and high level of job rotation...) possible but high level of admin work?!
b) the problem with b is if me as an ADMIN "ensure YOU have" how is this supposed to help the users reporting the issue if THEY DON'T have...!!
so i go for c), even though i don't like the user by user adding case (rather like to add a team or security role)

comments.content: maybe let the users access the right environment like question 217B. Select the menu icon on the top left, and toggle Show non-production apps to Yes. Most Voted

choices.B: Ensure you have the correct security role (Field Service - Resource), and that the security role is assigned to the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.
choices.D: Ensure you have the correct security role (Field Service - Offline Resource), and that the security role is assigned to the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.
choices.A: Update the mobile offline profile to include the correct Field Service security roles.
choices.C: Update the mobile offline profile to include the users that require access.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your company receives a call from a customer saying that the hydraulic pump they received from your company is defective. The pump is manufactured by your company.

You need to process a return.

Which three actions should be performed in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
To improve communications with customers, your company has decided to implement Twilio, a third-party communication platform that has call and messaging capabilities.
The Twilio solution includes a number of core components to deliver the capability, all of which need to be set up.
Which five steps should you take in sequence to prepare data for optimization? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
As per https://www.powerobjects.com/guides/powersms/ the order is
1. Setup a twilio Account
2. Obtain Phone Numbers
3. Generate account SID and authentication token
4. Install a Twilio-managed solution
5. Configure SMS and IVR solution

comments.content:
Agree with this answer. The guide given by Microsoft addresses it.

The "Generate account SID and authentication token" comes before the "Obtain Phone Numbers" step.

discussion.content:
Ref Link - URL: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=53586
Check - Twilio Integration Guide

3.Obtain Phone Numbers
4.Install a Twilio-managed solution
5.Configure SMS and IVR solution

to configure an SMS Channel:
Set up Twilio account
Generate account SID and Authentication Token
Get phone number
Add ms dynamics link to twilio, post and get (callback)
Get phone number
Set up channels in CRM with IVR workflows and such (phone number) SID/auth token.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/configure-sms-channel-twilio
for omnichannel customer service you now have direct phone call integration without twilio needed. and no solution from twilio to be installed. i was confused as i needed to add a phone number to open twilio. so i thought get phone number was the first prior opening twilio. though you need to "Obtain a TWILIO phone number", to be very explicit.

roughly this is:

Configure SMS and IVR workflows

discussion.content:
Set up a Twilio Account

Install Twilio managed solution

Obtain phone numbers

Configure MS flow account

Configure SMS and IVR workflows.

https://alphabold.com/dynamics-365-integration-with-twilio-using-microsoft-flow/

1. Setup a Twilio Account
2. Generate account SID and authentication token
3. Install a Twilio-managed solution
4. Obtain Phone Numbers
5. Configure SMS and IVR solution
Obtain Phone Number should be 3rd step.
Can anyone confirm which is the correct order? since am seeing multiple answers below

As per the https://us.hitachi-solutions.com/blog/dynamics-365-sms-integration-using-microsoft-flow-and-twilio/ link
1. Setup Twlio account - which covers the setup account and create the SID and PWD
2. install the Twlio solution - this is not mentioned but in the next steps we use the same in MS Flows
3. Obtain Phone numbers
4. Create a MS flow
5.Configure SMS and IVR solution

I think the order is right.

discussion.content:
Obtain phone numbers is before than install a Twilio-managed solution. 
As @JanM commented, if you download the installer + installation guide, in file: Twilio Integration guide.docx you can see the correct order
Please can someone provide a link to study for this topic? Thank you

comments.content:
As per document from JanM, the order is:
1. Setup a twilio Account
2. Generate account SID and authentication token
3. Obtain Phone Numbers
4. Install a Twilio-managed solution
5. Configure SMS and IVR solution
You can download the Installer + Installation guide, which details the steps neccessary, from the following URL: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=53586

questions.question_text:
You are a field service technician. You need to supply a fan belt for a compressor at a customer site. When checking the stock in your van you realize your fan belt inventory is showing 0.

You need to initiate a transfer from the stock at the home office.

Which two fields must you use to complete the transfer of stock? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
